page.title: 07Customs in Exbourne
page.content: Until a few years ago,there used to be a{Guy Fawkes Night Bonfire.}There was a big Parade up the hill to the bonfire,which was on the playing field. A brass band led the way.The people carried flaming torches. At the field there was a competition for the best Guy.There was a prize for it, usually a box of fireworks.Then all the Guys were burnt and the fireworks let off. Hot dogs and soup were sold. It was an exciting night and nearly all the village joined in. It stopped when the people who organized it moved away and nobody else would take it on. The elderly remember a{MAY QUEEN}on Mayday,but noone does it now.
